author: Jennifer Nehrer
description: The rollout of a new Instagram Map has prompted confusion among some users of the app, who voiced their privacy concerns online after Meta unveiled the feature
title: Instagram Maps feature raises privacy concerns among some users

description: New aerial images show widespread devastation in Gaza. It comes as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel intends to take over the entire territory. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell reports.
title: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu says Israel intends to take over Gaza

description: Kelly Clarkson's former husband and the father of her two children died following a three-year battle with cancer, his representative said in a statement. He was 48 years old.
title: Kelly Clarkson's ex-husband Brandon Blackstock dies at 48

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: New York City opened the country’s first city-funded shelter for transgender and gender-nonconforming people experiencing homelessness
title: NYC opens first-in-the-nation homeless shelter for transgender people

author: The Politics Desk
description: Zeroing in on the financial aspect of the Texas redistricting fight: the money Democratic lawmakers are forfeiting to flee the state and the limits of the party’s broader fundraising strategy.
title: The cold, hard cash hanging over the Texas redistricting fight: From the Politics Desk

author: Chloe Atkins
description: Republican Rep. Cory Mills of Florida allegedly threatened to release sexually explicit videos and images of a woman ex girlfriend.
title: GOP Rep. Cory Mills accused of threatening to release explicit videos and images of an ex

author: Chase Cain
description: The Trump administration is planning to undo most of the cuts to the National Weather Service put in place earlier this year by the Department of Government Efficiency
title: NWS to rehire workers after deep DOGE cuts

author: Melissa Chan
description: The soldier accused of opening fire Wednesday at his Army base in Georgia, wounding five people, had endured relentless bullying over his stutter almost as soon as he joined the military, former co-workers said.Sgt.
title: Fort Stewart shooting suspect was a hard worker who had been bullied over his stutter, Army soldiers say

author: Michael Kosnar
description: A senior FBI official who briefly served as acting director at the beginning of President Donald Trump's second term has been fired, two federal law enforcement sources told NBC News.
title: Former acting FBI director involved in Jan. 6 investigations fired

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump on Thursday announced he would nominate Council of Economic Advisers Chairman Stephen Miran to fill the open governor role at the Federal Reserve until the term expires in January
title: Trump to nominate Stephen Miran to serve on Fed's board until January

author: Claire Wang
description: Long popular in Asian countries, personal fans are everywhere lately and point to a rise in both temperatures and fast-fashion accessories.
title: The hottest fashion accessory right now will make you super cool: Mini portable fans

author: Ben Kamisar
description: As dozens of Texas state House Democrats near the one-week mark of their quorum break, fleeing the state indefinitely to prevent state GOP leaders from redrawing congressional lines, it's not just politics that loom over the strategy.
title: Finances weigh on Texas Democrats as costs of their quorum break add up

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: An Arizona teenager was arrested after throwing a sex toy into the crowd at a Phoenix Mercury game, police said, marking the fourth time such a "stupid prank" has unfolded at a WNBA contest in the past two weeks
title: 18-year-old arrested after allegedly throwing sex toy into crowd at Phoenix Mercury game

author: David K. Li
description: Kelly Clarkson's former husband and the father of her two children died following a three-year battle with cancer, his representative said on Thursday.
title: Kelly Clarkson's ex-husband Brandon Blackstock dead at 48

author: Albinson Linares
description: Immigrants who qualified and applied for U visas, reserved for victims of certain crimes who agree to help authorities, are no longer protected from deportation and fear for their future.
title: Immigrants who are crime victims and waiting for visas now face deportation

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he has instructed the Commerce Department to start a new U.S. census that will be "based on modern day facts and figures" and won't include undocumented immigrants."I have instructed our Department of Commerce to immediately begin work on a new and highly accurate CENSUS based on modern day facts and figures and, importantly, using the results and information gained from the Presidential Election of 2024," the president wrote in a post on TruthSocial.
title: Trump again seeks to omit undocumented immigrants from the census, contrary to the Constitution

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: Rep. Nancy Mace, a Republican candidate for South Carolina governor, said she’d “debate anyone” at a town hall where dissenters were asked to leave.
title: Rep. Nancy Mace said she'd 'debate anyone' at a town hall where opponents were asked to leave

author: Angela Yang
description: OpenAI on Thursday released the newest version of the artificial intelligence model that powers its popular ChatGPT chatbot, with CEO Sam Altman promoting it as like having a “team of Ph.D.
title: OpenAI releases GPT-5, calling it a ‘team of Ph.D. level experts in your pocket’

author: Kimmy Yam
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign a directive on Thursday, mandating universities to provide admissions data to prove that they are not implementing affirmative action policies.
title: Trump to require universities to hand over admissions data on race

author: Leslie Josephs, CNBC
description: American Airlines is reviving some of its pre-pandemic destinations like Prague and Budapest, Hungary, as international travel continues to hold up better than domestic demand
title: American adds Budapest, Prague and Buenos Aires flights for summer 2026

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds an event on National Purple Heart Day to honor recipients of the award for those wounded in military service.
title: Trump honors Purple Heart recipients at White House ceremony

description: The prime minister of India said he wouldn't compromise the interests of farmers even if it costs him.
title: India's Modi says he is ready to 'pay a big price' in the face of U.S. tariffs

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Dean Cain, the actor best known for playing the Man of Steel on the 1990s television series “Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman,” said this week he planned to become an officer for Immigration and Customs Enforcement
title: Dean Cain, Superman actor from 'Lois and Clark' TV show, joins ICE

author: David K. Li
description: An unarmed soldier tackled the gunman who opened fire at Fort Stewart before five others leaped into action to subdue the shooter and render life-saving medical care to victims, officials said Thursday
title: 6 unarmed soldiers praised for tackling and subduing Fort Stewart shooter

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Sen. John Cornyn, R-Texas, said Thursday that the FBI has approved his request for federal law enforcement to help locate Texas state Democratic lawmakers who left the state in an effort to block GOP redistricting efforts."I am proud to announce that Director Kash Patel has approved my request for the FBI to assist state and local law enforcement in locating runaway Texas House Democrats," Cornyn said in a statement
title: Sen. John Cornyn says the FBI granted his request to help find absent Texas Democrats

description: Brigadier General John Lubas gave details on the quick response from Fort Stewart personnel and other local first responders following the shooting that wounded five soldiers. Two of those soldiers remain hospitalized.
title: 'An incredibly fast response': Army outlines timeline of Fort Stewart shooting

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A Florida woman was arrested after allegedly posing as a nurse and treating thousands of patients with another nurse's license, authorities said.
title: Florida woman arrested after allegedly posing as nurse and treating patients with stolen license

author: Steve Kopack
description: President Donald Trump demanded that Lip-Bu Tan, CEO of tech firm, Intel resign immediately, saying he is “highly conflicted.”
title: Trump demands resignation of Intel CEO over alleged China ties

author: Jackson Peck
description: New aerial photos of the Gaza Strip have laid bare the magnitude of the destruction in the enclave, showing row upon row of shattered buildings interspersed with mounds of rubble and huge tent encampments
title: New photos show scale of destruction in Gaza as Israel weighs expanded military operation

author: Patrick Smith
description: Vance Boelter is accused of killing Minnesota Rep. Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark.
title: Man accused of killing Minnesota lawmaker to appear in court on murder charges

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Sweeping tariffs on dozens of countries have taken effect.
title: Tariffs on dozens on countries take effect and Kremlin confirms Trump-Putin meeting: Morning Rundown

description: President Donald Trump’s new wave of wide-ranging tariffs went into effect at Midnight Thursday morning with American consumers set to feel the impacts. Trump says the country is going to be “very rich,” but one estimate says all the tariffs will cost the average American family around $2,400 this year. NBC’s Christine Romans reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Says US Will Be ‘Very Rich’ as Tariffs Go Into Effect

description: New details are emerging after five soldiers were shot at Fort Stewart in Georgia allegedly by another member of their unit. The suspect has been identified as a 28-year-old from Florida. The injured soldiers were treated at the military hospital on the base and are all expected to recover. NBC’s Priya Sridhar reports for TODAY.
title: Alleged Gunman in Custody After Shooting at Fort Stewart

author: Lindsey Leake
description: Nearly 300 people who have participated in the Northwestern University SuperAging Program since 2000 have helped show impaired memory isn’t always part of aging.
title: New research reveals clues about memory and longevity from the brains of 'SuperAgers'

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: For now, the Voting Rights Act imposes some restraints on how congressional districts can be drawn. But the Supreme Court has also signaled it could further weaken the landmark law that protects minority voters.
title: A decade of Supreme Court rulings have given states increasingly unfettered power in redistricting

author: Angela Yang
description: Researchers are trying to “vaccinate” artificial intelligence systems against developing evil, overly flattering or otherwise harmful personality traits in a seemingly counterintuitive way: by giving them a small dose of those problematic traits.
title: Scientists want to prevent AI from going rogue by teaching it to be bad first

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Ultra-processed foods make up the bulk of what kids eat — and adults aren’t far behind, a report published Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds
title: Ultra-processed foods make up the majority of kids' diet, CDC report finds

author: Alexander Smith
description: The Kremlin said Thursday that a meeting between presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin has been agreed in principle and will happen in the “coming days.”Trump revealed a day before that he was hopeful of a meeting with his Russian counterpart in an attempt to end the war in Ukraine.
title: Kremlin says Putin-Trump meeting agreed, will happen in 'coming days'

author: Peter Guo
description: Police in southwestern China scuffled this week with protesters demanding greater justice for a 14-year-old girl bullied by her schoolmates.
title: Attack on teenage girl sparks rare protests in China as video goes viral

author: Rob Wile
description: After months of delays and extensions, President Donald Trump’s comprehensive and sweeping tariffs slate took effect Thursday just after midnight ET, shifting his global trade reset into high gear
title: New tariffs snap into effect, raising import taxes to highest level since Great Depression

author: Amy Eley
description: Kelly Clarkson said she is postponing the rest of her “Studio Session” concerts in Las Vegas this month as her family faces a difficult chapter
title: Kelly Clarkson says her ex-husband has been ill, postpones August concerts in Las Vegas

author: Abigail Williams
description: The Trump administration is scaling back the State Department’s annual Human Rights Report and placing a new focus on restrictions on freedom of expression by U.S. allies as well as adversaries.
title: Trump administration to scale back annual human rights reports

author: The Associated Press
description: France’s biggest wildfire in years was spreading quickly Wednesday in a Mediterranean region near Spain after leaving one person dead and several injured, authorities said.
title: France's biggest wildfire of the summer has eclipsed the size of Paris and is still spreading

author: The Associated Press
description: UNITED NATIONS — Afghanistan’s Taliban rulers have “weaponized” the legal and judicial system to oppress women and girls in what amounts to “crimes against humanity,” the independent U.N. investigator on human rights in the country said
title: Afghanistan's Taliban have 'weaponized' the judicial system to oppress women, UN expert says

author: Mike Hixenbaugh
description: After a convicted sex offender abused students through Chi Alpha, an Assemblies of God program, officials announced policy changes. Some say it's not enough.
title: Assemblies of God leaders address sex abuse of boys and young men in Texas sauna

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: A United Airlines outage has prompted a ground stop across the country, including at major airport hubs in Newark, Chicago, San Francisco and Houston.
title: United Airlines outage prompts ground stop at major U.S. hubs

description: United Airlines has requested a ground stop at major airports, including Chicago, Newark, Houston, and other major hubs. NBC News’ Jay Blackman explains the “technology issue” behind the flight delay.
title: United Airlines requests ground stop at major airports

author: Tom Winter
description: The House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform on Tuesday listed former attorneys general, a former FBI director, former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton as people all subject to subpoenas for matters tied to Jeffrey Epstein
title: Congress doesn't want to talk to Alex Acosta, Epstein's 'sweetheart deal' maker

author: Dan De Luce
description: National Intelligence Director Tulsi Gabbard decided to declassify a document on Russia’s interference in the 2016 election last month over the objections of CIA officials who argued that more details should remain secret to protect sensitive spying sources and methods, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.
title: Tulsi Gabbard declassified documents over objections from CIA, sources say

author: The Associated Press
description: ACCRA, Ghana — A military helicopter crashed in Ghana on Wednesday, killing all eight people on board, including the West African country’s defense and environment ministers and two other top officials, the government said
title: Helicopter crash in Ghana kills ministers of defense and environment and 6 others

author: Raquel Coronell Uribe
description: The president's law enforcement comments came a day after Tuesday's threat to federalize control of the local government in Washington, D.C.
title: Trump threatens to take over D.C. police and says he might deploy the National Guard
